class.name: EPASWheelLocomotion
class.description:
The EPAS Wheel locomotion system works by having a virtual wheel of a certain radius that moves along with the character, as if it was dragging on the ground. To support blending between different movement types (for example, walking and running) each type must be defined as a locomotion set. Each locomotion set must have poses, these poses are laid out with equal distance between them. The recommended pose arrangement for character locomotion is: Contact Left, Passing Left, Contact Right, Passing Right, Contact Left.
Step length = 1/4 the circumference of the surveyor wheel Full cycle = step length * 2 Wheel radius = (4*step_length) / (2*PI)

method.name: get_current_step_length
method.description: Gets the current interpolated step length.

method.name: get_locomotion_set_count
method.description: Gets how many locomotion sets are in this node.

method.name: get_wheel_angle
method.description: Gets the current angle of the wheel in degrees. [b]Note:[/b] This value doesn't wrap, might want to use [code]fmod[/code] or [code]fposmod[/code].

method.name: set_linear_velocity
method.description: Sets the current linear velocity for the wheel to use.

method.name: set_locomotion_set_animation
method.description: Sets the animation of a locomotion set to the given animation. [b]Note:[/b] This animation should start from 0 and be 1 second in length.

method.name: set_locomotion_set_step_length
method.description: Sets the step length of a locomotion set.
